Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Reverend Ray Bagnuolo, Jan Hus Presbyterian Church, 351 East 74th Street, New York, NY 10021.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Lappin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Reverend Ray Bagnuolo, Jan Hus Presbyterian Church, 351 East 74th Street, New York, N.Y. 10021.

Council Member Lappin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of October 27 and November 17, 2010 be adopted as printed by Council Member James.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member James moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 27, 2010 and November 17, 2010 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Reyna:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 149 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11211, Community Board 1, Application 20115171 TCK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Unenclosed Sidewalk Café, 149 Broadway, Brooklyn (20115171TCK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Report of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in seven business improvement districts.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to the naming of the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Naming of the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge.

Items.Title: Resolution  calling on the United States Congress to pass H.R. 147 to allow taxpayers to designate a portion of their income tax payment to provide assistance to homeless veterans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass H.R. 147 to allow taxpayers to designate a portion of their income tax payment to provide assistance to homeless veterans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring that community planning boards also receive the annual report submitted to the mayor, the council and the borough presidents on all jobs retained and created as a result of the sale of city-owned property through an agreement with entities which enter into contracts with the department of small business services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Requiring that community planning boards also receive the annual report submitted to the mayor, the council and the borough presidents on all jobs retained and created as a result of the sale of city-owned property through an agreement with entities which

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming six thoroughfares and public places, Prospect Avenue, Borough of Queens, Hamilton Place, Borough of Queens, Orient Avenue, Borough of Queens, Church Street, Borough of Queens, Pine Street, Borough of Queens, Poplar Street, Borough of Queens and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Name Changes, Renaming 6 thoroughfares and public places.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the livery passenger bill of rights.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Livery passenger bill of rights.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Board of Elections to provide data to be included in the Mayor’s Management Report and to make such data available to the public on the Board’s website.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Board of Elections to provide data to be included in the Mayor’s Management Report and to make such data available to the public on the Board’s website.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to increasing the maximum age for qualifying for membership in the fire department for certain persons.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum age for qualifying for membership in the fire department for certain persons.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact legislation that requires a father to be named on a child’s birth certificate before the mother of such a child is considered eligible to receive child support.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to enact legislation that requires a father to be named on a child’s birth certificate before the mother of such a child is considered eligible to receive child support.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend the Penal Law by classifying certain sexual assaults as class A felonies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the Penal Law by classifying certain sexual assaults as class A felonies.
